metadata.title: CVE-2017-5507 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Memory leak in coders/mpc.c in ImageMagick before 6.9.7-4 and 7.x before7.0.4-4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memoryconsumption) via vectors involving a pixel cache.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.5').
